Reading About

Reading

I continually try to reshape what design means to me through reading - whether thatâ€™s through books or various things I find online. Here are some of the books and resources that have been the most influential in defining who I am as a designer.

Books

  • The Laws of Simplicity by John Maeda
  • The Shape of Design by Frank Chimero
  • The Design of Everyday Things by Donald Norman
  • The Visual Display of Quantitative Information by Edward Tufte
  • Thinking with Type by Ella Lupton
  • Design is a Job by Mike Monteiro

Websites

  • Designer News
  • Hacker News
  • A List Apart
  • CSS Tricks
  • Smashing Magazine

Videos

  • Ira Glass on Storytelling
  • How Designers Destroyed the World
  • Inventing on Principle
